@Will-Lo Thanks for this PR! It is very timely given the 0.15.0 release I am working on.
@abti @htran1 Please review.

> @sv2000 : This works.
> A suggestion: Did you consider factoring out the temp directory generator into another class (perhaps in the module: gobblin-test-utils) and have every test use it directly?
> 
> Usage might look like:
> 
> TestDirectoryManager dirMgr = new TestDirectoryManager(this.getClass()); // this sets up the root path, attaches to the calling class.
> this.taskStateFile = dirMgr.getDirectoryPath("/taskState/_RUNNING");

Thanks @shirshanka ! Yes, I did think of re-factoring the tmp dir creation. However, I did not see much of a benefit (in terms of avoiding code duplication) since the equivalent of the "TestDirectoryManager" needs to be duplicated whenever a tmp dir is created. Further, the tmp dir creation is really only 2 lines of code - one to create the directory itself and one for marking the dir for deletion.

Added commit to fix findbugs and tests.

Also checking in reordered restli snapshot.json files, I think there was a restli change where these are in alphabetical order when generated, so they will keep showing up as modified in git after building unless we check in the updated one.

@sv2000 : I think the standardization of how temporary directories are created and how directories from within them are handed out might be useful refactoring for future test writers. They won't need to remember how to create a temp directory, how to combine a temp directory with inner directories etc. 
I know it seems like a nit, but I think it sets up the "testing harness" in a better way IMO.
@shirshanka Thanks for the comment. Will address.

@Will-Lo thanks that one is fixed. The more problematic part is the parquetOutputFormatTest integration test which fails because the Parquet hive output format is deep in Hive.
The only way to being able to use the newer version of Parquet is to bump the Hive version as well. -> https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-11096
Upgrading Hive is quite risky for us as we've tried before and it failed in the past. Is it possible to add the upgraded version of hive as a shadow jar in the test module?

@treff7es I can't seem to replicate the problem you're facing, instead `parquetOutputFormatTest` is hanging for me when I run it with gradle, but not intellij. Could you give me more details so that I can try shadowing a hive jar?

After doing some investigation we think the best solution would be to disable the test and document in `HiveWritableHdfsDataWriter` that it currently does not support parquet. I made a ticket detailing the problem here: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GOBBLIN-1318

in the test class, I ideally wanted to mock up the `addDelegationToken` method for the `Filesystem` so that It can provide the mock'ed up tokens. but because Gobblin uses very old version of `mockito`, it can not mock up static methods. I tried `powerMockito` as well but it didnt work. so for now I have mock up the entire method `getNewDelegationTokenForLoginUser`.
